glsa.title: Newspost: Buffer overflow vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow can be exploited to crash Newspost remotely and potentially execute arbitrary code.

background.p: Newspost is a Usenet News binary autoposter.

description.p: Niels Heinen has discovered a buffer overflow in the socket_getline() function of Newspost, which can be triggered by providing long strings that do not end with a newline character.

impact.p: A remote attacker could setup a malicious NNTP server and entice a Newspost user to post to it, leading to the crash of the Newspost process and potentially the execution of arbitrary code with the rights of the Newspost user.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
